detailsOfAchievement: WAIA, as the organization is known, consists of a diverse group of members, who have come together with a common motive of creating an improved and better society. The organization thrives to motivate and educate the most deprived members of society through its various social awareness activities.Objectives of WAIA: - The members of WAIA strongly believe that society and its future can be greatly benefited by improving the adolescents, education, health and social environment. The youth of today are the pillar of tomorrows society and by providing a healthy and safe atmosphere, we, at WAIA can help to create a better world.WAIA Educate India Project- This educational based program targets both school and non-school going children. Under the Non-School Going category, children from very poor background and Our other mentoring program, which falls under the School Going Category, aims to assist school going children in preparing for subjects like Science, English and Math before their board exams. WAIA Educate India also focuses on providing healthcare to its students, who would be evaluated when joining the Educate India Project and during its term. This project is a time bound activity, with the sole purpose to take students a step forward in achieving their academic or educational goal. Under this project, WAIA aims at providing free education through mentoring, vocational training, computer training, distribution of books, providing free stationery and through sponsorship of both needful and academically excelling students. To create a positive environment, WAIA has organized mass awareness activities that focused on youth related issues like Adolescent Awareness. We have been conducting quiz and debate competitions which primarily targeted the youth, who are the future of tomorrow. Another focus area of our NGO (non governmental organization) is in the primary healthcare sector where the members of WAIA intend to provide increased access to healthcare facilities. We plan to educate the masses about adopting prevention measures from contagious diseases like tuberculosis, seasonal diseases like malaria, diarrhea etc. This would be conducted during the free check up clinics organized for the needy. For this, we would be utilizing mobile medical units, which is basically a fully equipped ambulance that would handle patients needs. The mobile medical unit would be distributing free medicines, checking blood pressure and attending to the medical needs of the poor people of the community. By this we would be covering both the preventive and curative aspects of WAIAs health awareness ventures.

detailsOfAchievement: The objects for this trust is established are: (a) To establish, develop, maintain and grant aid in cash or in kind to hospitals, medical,schools, medical colleges, nursing institutions, dispensaries, maternity homes, child welfare centres and/or such other similar charitable institutions in India for the benefit and use of the general public. (b) To establish, run, support and grant aid or other financial assistance to schools,colleges, libraries, reading rooms, universities, laboratories, research and other institutions of the like nature in India, for use of the students and the staff and also for the development and advancement of education and diffusion of knowledge amongst the public in general. (c) To establish, maintain and run studentships, scholarships and render other kind of aid to students including supply of books, stipends, medals and other incentives to study, without any distinction as to caste, colour, race,creed or sex. (d) To promote, establish, support, maintain or grant aid to institutions for the promotion of science, literature, music, drama and fine arts,for the preservation of historical monuments and for the research and other institutions, in India, having similar objects for the benefit of the public in general. (e) To establish, maintain or grant aid for the establishment and/or maintenance of parks, gardens, gymnasiums, sports clubs, dharamshalas and rest houses, for use by public in general. (f) To establish, maintain or grant aid to homes for the aged, orphanages or other establishments for the relief and help to the poor, needy and destitute people, orphans, widows and aged persons. (g) To establish and develop institutions for the physically handicapped and disabled or mentally retarded persons and to provide them education, food, clothing or other help. (h) To grant relief and assistance to the needy victims during natural calamities such as famine, earth quake, flood, fire, pestilence, etc.and to give donations and other assistance to institutions, establishments or persons engaged in such relief work.

Starting from 8th July, 1974, WBVHA has gained its experience of more than four decades.

detailsOfAchievement: Education: Pre-primary education and coaching support in the red light areas covering 1483 beneficiaries. A holistic education programme for street children, which includes non-formal education, mainstreaming and coaching for 650 children in 15 Police Stations. Nutrition: Supplementary nutrition provided to all children attending the education centres. Anti Trafficking Network: Secretariat ATSEC West Bengal, working on prevention of trafficking and sexual abuse of women and children in 9 districts. Prevention of cross border trafficking in women and children, between West Bengal, India and Bangladesh. Developing rights based approach against anti trafficking actions in South Asia: Awareness generation; Capacity building of government officials, elected representatives, law enforcement agencies, law school students and high school students; Rescue; Rehabilitation; Reintegration and Repatriation of trafficked victims. Child Protection: 3 shelter homes, integrated institutional complex for 225 girl children from red light areas, lost, abandoned and girl children at risk, trafficking survivors and street children. Vocational training and Income generation programmes: Organising urban and rural women for skill development and income generation activities, such as - formation of SHGs, skill training, marketing, facilitating in opening Bank accounts and accessing loans. HIV-AIDS: In 2 districts the activities include awareness, male and female condom promotion, counselling, referral service and stigma removal of HIV positive. Integrated Water, Health, Hygiene and Sanitation: Construction of toilets in red light areas, villages, municipalities, low cost house hold latrines, sinking hand pumps, promoting stand post, health education and diarrhoea prevention. Adopt a Granny: with aged women in prostitution in red light areas are cared for with monthly sponsorship. Endogenous Rural Tourism: To bring about improvement in the livelihood pattern and development of the tribal community, particularly women through group formation, training and capacity building, promotion of their art and culture, handicrafts. Legal Aid for Women: Government approved service provider under the PWDV Act 2005. Providing training to Protection Officers and Police. Alternative Source of Energy: Setting up of Solar light in a village.
